title: Texans' D thumps Bills, stakes claim as NFL's best
content: Against one of the NFL's top offenses, the Texans showed why they have the No. 1-ranked defense, sacking Josh Allen eight times and forcing three turnovers in a 23-19 win.

title: Lamb: Missed Vegas curfew prompted benching
content: Cowboys wide receiver CeeDee Lamb said he and George Pickens missed curfew Sunday, which resulted in both players missing the first series of Monday's game against the Raiders.

title: Lakers fire Buss brothers from scouting roles
content: The Lakers are reorganizing their basketball operations department and have terminated brothers Joey and Jesse Buss from their respective front office positions.

title: Sources: Players unmoved by WNBA's proposal
content: The WNBPA believes the league's latest CBA proposal misses the mark and does not include a system where the salary cap and player salaries sufficiently grow with the business, sources told ESPN.

title: Maxey has career-high 54 as 76ers outlast Bucks
content: Sixers guard Tyrese Maxey had a career-high 54 points and nine assists in a 123-114 overtime victory over the Bucks on Thursday.

title: Ovechkin's hat trick puts him 10th on points list
content: Alex Ovechkin had his 33rd career hat trick and added an assist to move into 10th place on the NHL points list, helping the Capitals beat Montreal 8-4 on Thursday night.

title: Darnold: Seattle's NFL-high 20 TO's 'unacceptable'
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold says he understands he and the team have to be better protecting the ball after a four-week stretch in which they've committed 12 turnovers, bringing their NFL-worst total to 20.

title: Las Vegas GP: Drain cover causes red flags again
content: The 2023 Las Vegas GP saw Carlos Sainz's Ferrari damaged by a loose drain cover, with the 2025 edition causing red flags in FP2.

content: The Wildcats added another statement win to their early-season r√©sum√©, headlining this week's top-25 risers.

content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to Bahamas tournaments, the next 10 days are filled with big nonconference games.

content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

content: Florida's championship rings feature significant nods to the national title game, its iconic season and program history.

title: Barnwell: Is Nick Sirianni the most scrutinized successful coach in NFL history?
content: The Eagles' head coach is 56-22 over five seasons, including two trips to the Super Bowl. Yet he's constantly under the microscope. Why?

title: NWSL faces litmus test to retain Trinity Rodman's star power
content: Trinity Rodman represents some of the very best that the NWSL has to offer. That's why Saturday's NWSL Championship -- perhaps her final game -- feels so significant.

title: Matt Bowen's ultimate guide to winning a fantasy football championship
content: Even Jonathan Taylor can't do it all by himself. Fantasy managers have a role to play too.  Here's what to do.

content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Las Vegas Grand Prix: What to know ahead of the F1 weekend
content: With three races remaining of the 2025 season, Formula 1 heads to Las Vegas for the third edition of the glitzy grand prix. Find out all the timings, stats and information for the weekend.

title: How Mbapp√©'s start at Real Madrid compares to greats like Ronaldo, Benzema
content: Kylian Mbapp√© has reached 75 games at Real Madrid in his best form since joining them. How does his start compare to some of the club's greatest strikers?

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: Bradley's take: Can Haney avoid Norman's left hook?
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down the Brian Norman Jr.-Devin Haney title fight, and shares his thoughts on how the fight could play out.

title: The running man: Odds are Josh Allen makes QB TD history on Thursday night
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Scott McTominay back
content: Manchester United are considering a move to bring Scott McTominay back to Old Trafford from Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: ‚ÄòEko‚Äô movie review: A solid mystery thriller in which animals play as big a part as humans
content: Dinjith Ayyathan‚Äôs ‚ÄòEko‚Äô dives into a world where animals and humans are more connected than you would think, and ends up as a solid mystery thriller thanks to its brilliant screenplay

title: Government committed to welfare of fisherfolk, says Andhra Pradesh Fisheries Minister Atchannaidu
content: Coastal development initiatives are being prioritised to ensure long-term economic stability for the fishing communities, he says

title: BLO ends life in Gujarat; family says death due to mental stress from SIR duty
content: A delegation of Gujarat Rajya Prathmik Shikshak Sangh, an association of government primary teachers, met election officials in Gandhinagar and made a representation about issues being faced by teachers working as BLOs.

title: Forest departments across India have no record of African grey parrot trade, reveal RTI responses
content: The parrot, which is listed under Appendix I of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Flora and Fauna (CITES), requires special permits, including individual CITES registration and import certificates, for their trade in the domestic and international markets

title: TMC slams Shah over remarks on SIR; calls him ‚Äòincapable Home Minister‚Äô, demands his resignation
content: ‚ÄúBLOs are being threatened, overworked and pushed to breaking point. Thirty-one lives have already been lost in this SIR-driven climate of fear," Senior Minister Shashi Panja claimed.

title: Udupi police arrest two UP men for sharing information on Indian Navy ships with Pakistan
content: Police suspect at least one of them of sharing sensitive classified information about naval ships for the last 18 months

title: Qualification criteria for electricity worker‚Äôs post in KSEB amended after 27 years
content: Updated qualifications require SSLC or equivalent for candidates while maintaining physical standards.

title: Ilaiyaraaja moves Madras High Court to protect his personality rights
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar injuncts TV channels, YouTube channels, social media influencers & others from using his name, title, and photos for commercial gain

title: Schools to report on compliance with mental health guidelines: Education minister
content: Following the alleged death of a class 10 student, Delhi Minister Ashish Sood will seek a detailed report on all the CBSE schools mental health guidelines

title: Did the SIR process decide Bihar‚Äôs election outcome? Data says ‚ÄúNo‚Äù
content: The NDA‚Äôs advantages registered in the Lok Sabha elections in terms of vote share differences with the MGB remained mostly intact, despite a decrease in electorate numbers following the SIR

title: Protection of red sanders: National Biodiversity Board releases ‚Çπ39.84 crore to Andhra Pradesh
content: An amount of ‚Çπ87.68 crore was generated through regulated access to auctioned or seized red sanders wood by the Andhra Pradesh Forest Department towards benefit sharing

title: IAF‚Äôs Tejas fighter jet crashes at Dubai Air Show; pilot killed
content: Viral visuals on social media capture the aircraft spiraling out of control just above the ground, igniting on impact, and sliding for a short distance before being engulfed in flames

title: The Hindu Lit for Life Dialogue Bengaluru LIVE: Author Sanjaya Baru urges India to address net loss of human capital
content: Three compelling sessions with an impressive line-up of speakers, including Manu Joseph and Sanjaya Baru

title: Labour laws passed by Parliament in 2020 comes into effect today
content: ‚ÄúNew labour reforms are an important step towards a self-reliant India and will give new momentum to the goal of a developed India by 2047,‚Äù says Mansukh Mandaviya

title: Gajuwaka‚Äôs cement unit plan raises a ‚Äòdust‚Äô
content: Gajuwaka residents lament that they have been experiencing dust and industrial pollution due to the presence of numerous small and medium industries in the area. The constant movement of trucks from the city to the industries in the Gajuwaka Assembly constituency is only adding to their problems. They fear that the proposed cement grinding unit will only worsen their health conditions and urge the government and the local representatives to stop the proposed plant, writes V. Kamalakara Rao

title: DMK-led alliance to protest Centre‚Äôs refusal to relax moisture-content limit for paddy procurement
content: Protests will be held on November 23 in Thanjavur and on November 24 in Tiruvarur, said a joint statement from the parties

title: Seven States enact laws on lines of Jan Vishwas Act to encourage business
content: Seven states, including Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh, passed their own legislations or promulgated ordinances on the lines of the Jan Vishwas Act, making it the largest coordinated deregulation push undertaken at the State level to date

title: Supreme Court issues notice to EC as Kerala Government, political parties seek deferment of SIR
content: J. Kant remarks that political parties have now started coming to Supreme Court on the SIR issue. More parties contest the revision exercise and seek its deferment in Kerala

title: High costs, poor training deepen India‚Äôs stinging snakebite toll
content: New findings show that faster access to hospitals, improved anti-venoms, and health insurance are urgently needed to prevent avoidable deaths

title: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah rules out leadership change
content: CM reiterates he will present next two budgets amid loyalists of DyCM camping in Delhi, sparking speculation about a possible demand for a change in leadership

title: T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin calls Sanskrit ‚Äòdead language,‚Äô BJP hits back
content: Taking offence to his terminology, BJP leader Tamilisai Soundararajan said no one has the right to call any language dead, especially the one that is still used today in prayers and rituals across the country.

title: SIR for purification of voters‚Äô list, Bihar win mandate against infiltrators, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah was addressing the BSF Diamond Jubilee (61st Raising Day) celebrations in Bhuj, in Gujarat‚Äôs Kutch district

title: Fancy being a traffic cop for a day in Bengaluru?
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru‚Äôs busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: Assam Day celebrated at 44th India International Trade Fair in Delhi
content: Assam's Minister for Industries and Commerce, Bimal Borah, explained the State's growing potential under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision of 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat'

title: Disproportionate assets case: Kerala HC quashes Vigilance court order against ADGP Ajith Kumar
content: High Court cites procedural flaw in quashing an order by Vigilance court that sought inquiry against M.R. Ajith Kumar. The court also expunges all observations made against CM Pinarayi Vijayan in Vigilance court order

title: Anti-encroachment drive carried out on 16 acres of land on outskirts of Jammu
content: ‚ÄúOver 10 structures have been demolished so far by the administration amid heavy security measures,‚Äù says officials

title: Infant dies of snakebite in Kerala
content: According to police, the one-year-old boy was playing in the backyard of house when a venomous snake, reportedly a cobra, bit him on his leg

title: Four of family die of asphyxiation after fire in house
content: The victims were Kamal Doshi (50), a jeweller, his wife Devalben (45), and their sons Dev (24) and Raj (22)

title: Fire breaks out at Hindalco's New York plant, second time in over two months
content: Everyone working at the plant was safely evacuated and fortunately, there were no injuries, the company said

title: New Nitish Kumar cabinet full of corrupts, criminals, alleges Prashant Kishor
content: The new cabinet of Nitish Kumar, which took oath on Thursday, is full of corrupt and criminals. I must say that this council of ministers is a slap in the face of the people of Bihar, says Jan Suraaj leader Prashant Kishor

title: U.P.: BJP MLA stages protest against police in Lucknow over 'bribery'; two cops sent to lines
content: The MLA further alleged that policemen were issuing challans arbitrarily to meet "targets", even when motorists had valid documents

title: 10 patients suffering life-threatening clots in veins get new lease of life at SDM Narayana Heart Centre in Dharwad
content: SDM Narayana Heart Centre of Dharwad has successfully performed an advanced procedure to cure 10 patients who were suffering from life-threatening clots in the veins

title: Annapurna Studios and Ramanaidu Studios in Hyderabad served with notices for higher trade license fee payments
content: GHMC authorities referred to property tax records to know the actual plinth area of the establishments

title: Mega shift in Bihar cabinet: CM Nitish gives home portfolio to BJP; who got what
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has finalized his expanded cabinet, assigning portfolios after his tenth swearing-in. The BJP, as the largest party, received key ministries including Home, Land and Revenue, and Health. Smaller allies like LJP(R), HAM, and RLM have also been allocated significant departments, following a grand ceremony attended by national leaders.

title: 'All 140 MLAs are mine': DK Shivakumar on Karnataka CM post; Siddaramaiah responds
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar asserted that all 140 MLAs are his, dismissing speculation about groupism amid cabinet reshuffle talks. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah clarified that cabinet decisions rest with the high command, stating he will present the next budget and continue his term. Shivakumar also reassured party workers about his continued leadership role.

title: Tech Billionaire Rankings Shake Up: Google Founder Surpasses Jeff Bezos ‚Äî Here‚Äôs Why
content: Google co-founder Larry Page has become the world's third-richest person, surpassing Jeff Bezos as Alphabet's shares surged following the Gemini 3 AI model launch. Page's net worth increased significantly, placing him behind Elon Musk and Larry Ellison. The article highlights AI's impact on billionaire rankings, noting Oracle's recent stock volatility.

title: India's 'musical-chair' story: Gambhir & No.3 conundrum - 7 batters in 18 Tests
content: India's Test struggles at home are amplified by the constant shuffling at the No.3 batting position. Under coach Gautam Gambhir, seven different batters have occupied this crucial slot in just 18 Tests, raising concerns about stability and planning. This instability at one-down has become a focal point as Team India seeks to regain balance in their red-ball setup.

title: Nvidia CEO to Staff: Market Is Unhappy With Our Results ‚Äî ‚ÄòDid You See the Memes?‚Äô
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang humorously addressed the company's record-breaking earnings, noting the immense pressure and market scrutiny. Despite a stellar quarter with $57 billion revenue and a strong forecast, Huang acknowledged the 'no-win situation' where even slight deviations spark global concern. He highlighted the company's vital role in the AI boom, stating, 'We're basically holding the planet together.'

title: Viral post highlights emotional toll of sudden job loss‚Äî 7 research-backed ways to cope
content: As the shock of sudden layoffs reverberates through the workforce, many are left feeling deceived and vulnerable following reassurances of job security. Studies reveal that these abrupt decisions can heighten stress and disrupt the fundamental trust that forms the employer-employee relationship. Professionals recommend recognizing these sentiments and embracing constructive strategies to ease the transition and foster thoughtful decision-making.

title: 'Bomb-making' machine in Faridabad: How Dr Muzammil improvised his explosive setup; first pics out
content: A flour mill in Faridabad was converted into a chemical workshop by a terror suspect. This suspect, Muzammil, was involved in the Delhi car blast. Investigators found evidence of meticulous planning for over two years. Nearly 3,000kg of explosives and arms were discovered. The network is being dismantled to prevent further attacks.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI; calls shift 'critical'
content: Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, an advanced AI image generator powered by Gemini 3. This upgrade offers superior reasoning, enhanced world knowledge, and precise text rendering. Users can now create higher-resolution images, control lighting and camera angles, and integrate real-time Google Search data, marking a significant leap for creative professionals.

title: 4 Labour Codes made effective to simplify and streamline labour laws - check top details
content: India's government has announced the implementation of four consolidated labor codes, effective November 21, 2025, to modernize regulations and strengthen worker protections. This significant policy shift rationalizes 29 existing laws, aiming to create a future-ready labor ecosystem that promotes formalization, ensures timely wages, and expands social security for all workers.

title: IND vs SA: 'Someone who gives that freedom' - Pant on 'real goal'
content: Rishabh Pant takes charge of India's Test side against South Africa in Guwahati, stepping in for Shubman Gill.  Pant, making his Test captaincy debut at a venue dear to him, discussed team balance and his leadership philosophy of fostering player freedom. He anticipates a good batting wicket in Guwahati, with spin expected later.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit ‚ÄúTweaker‚Äù featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife earns major nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty Awards
content: Ayesha Curry's beauty brand, Sweet July Skin, has earned a nomination for Best Category Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards for its successful Lip Treatment. This recognition follows previous accolades for the brand, highlighting its growing impact in the beauty industry. The winners will be revealed on December 2, 2025.

title: Taylor Swift moves on with Travis Kelce, refuses Joe Alwyn‚Äôs plea for closure
content: Nearly two years after their breakup, reports resurfaced detailing Joe Alwyn's desire for a final conversation with Taylor Swift to find closure. However, Swift had already processed her emotions through music and moved on, finding healing and new love with Travis Kelce. Her friends supported her decision to avoid revisiting the past, prioritizing her current stability and future.

title: 89 and falling: Rupee hits record low; biggest drop since July amid weak equity cues
content: The Indian rupee experienced its sharpest single-day decline in over three months on Friday, falling past the 89-per-dollar mark for the first time. This significant drop occurred amidst a weak sentiment in both domestic and global equity markets. The currency's fall was influenced by global cues and a flat growth in the country's core infrastructure sectors.

title: Trump sanctions take effect today: Will India stop buying Russian crude oil? Yes ‚Äî and no.
content: US sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil, effective November 21, 2025, are impacting India's oil imports. Russian crude loadings for India have significantly dropped, forcing refiners to seek alternative sources. While direct procurement from sanctioned entities will cease, Russia's oil may continue to flow through less transparent channels, impacting global trade dynamics.

title: ‚ÄòLife-threatening situation‚Äô: 10 reasons why Delhi is in a pollution health emergency
content: Delhi's air quality has plunged into a life-threatening emergency, exceeding 'severe' levels due to open fires, vehicles, and garbage burning, not just stubble. Hospitals are overwhelmed, schools are disrupted, and citizen protests highlight systemic failures. Experts urge region-wide emission controls and waste management fixes to prevent a year-round health catastrophe.

title: Fact vs fiction: Why did Gill fly from Kolkata to Guwahati despite the injury?
content: Shubman Gill's travel to Guwahati for the second Test against South Africa was a calculated risk, with management hoping for a last-minute recovery. Despite no red flags from the BCCI medical team, Gill was deemed not to be match-fit, leading to his eventual withdrawal and travel to Mumbai for specialist consultation.

title: Bihar: Kishor outlines plan after poll rout; urges people to donate to Jan Suraaj
content: Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor pledged to donate 90% of his income for the next five years to fund his party's campaign after its debut Bihar assembly election failure. He also criticised the Nitish Kumar cabinet as corrupt and accused the ruling alliance of vote-buying through cash transfers, vowing to ensure women receive promised funds.

title: First time in 116 years! Day 1 of AUS vs ENG scripts cricketing history
content: A dramatic Ashes opening day saw 19 wickets tumble, with England's bowlers seizing the initiative. Mitchell Starc's seven-wicket haul initially put England in trouble, but Ben Stokes' exceptional five-wicket haul then decimated Australia. Despite batting first, England fought back strongly to end the day with a lead, setting up a thrilling contest.

title: Trump tariff impact: CBO trims deficit-cut estimate by $1trillion
content: The Congressional Budget Office has revised its deficit reduction forecast for President Trump's tariffs, now projecting $3 trillion over a decade, down from $4 trillion. This adjustment stems from updated data and recent tariff changes. While critics argue consumers bear tariff costs, the White House maintains foreign exporters pay, generating significant revenue.

title: '7km long, 25m deep': Israel reveals one of Gaza's 'largest & most complex' tunnels - video
content: The IDF revealed a vast Hamas tunnel network in southern Gaza, reportedly used to hold the body of soldier Hadar Goldin. This complex, stretching over seven kilometers and featuring numerous rooms, ran beneath civilian areas. Hamas returned Goldin's remains after 11 years, following his abduction during the 2014 Gaza War.

title: Not saved enough for retirement? Top 5 things to do - here‚Äôs how to catch up
content: Retiring comfortably after starting late is achievable. Prioritize boosting savings significantly, even if it means trimming lifestyle expenses. Avoid high-risk investments; instead, focus on disciplined saving and a modest equity allocation. Consider extending your working years or exploring a reverse mortgage if your nest egg remains insufficient. These strategies can help secure your desired retirement.

title: 'Varanasi' controversy: Ram Gopal Varma defends SS Rajamouli amid atheism row
content: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has publicly defended SS Rajamouli after the director faced backlash for declaring himself an atheist. Varma argued that atheism is constitutionally protected and that an artist's personal beliefs shouldn't limit their creative expression. He suggested critics' jealousy fuels the controversy, asserting Rajamouli's success will continue regardless.

title: Sebi chairman TK Pandey rejects fresh framework on digital gold - here's what he said
content: Sebi chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey clarified that the regulator is not developing new frameworks for digital gold, emphasizing that only existing, regulated options like gold ETFs and tradable gold securities are under its purview.  He also discussed Sebi's efforts to enhance the market for REITs and InvITs, including their classification for mutual funds.

title: Video: Palash Muchhal proposes to Smriti Mandhana
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal are set to marry on November 23rd. Muchhal's heartwarming proposal video at DY Patil Stadium, where India won the Women's World Cup, has gone viral. Mandhana playfully confirmed their engagement with teammates. Prime Minister Modi also sent heartfelt wishes, noting their union as a blend of accomplished journeys.

title: Emergency captaincy! Pant drops truth bomb ‚Äî 'Not the best scenario'
content: Rishabh Pant will captain India in the second Test against South Africa after Shubman Gill's injury. Acknowledging the unusual circumstances, Pant expressed gratitude for the opportunity and emphasized focusing on winning the crucial match. He confirmed Gill's replacement is decided, praising the injured skipper's resilience. Pant aims for a balanced approach, blending conventional and innovative strategies for victory.

title: 'Teacher said he did it intentionally': Father of student who died by suicide in Delhi
content: The suicide note, recovered from the student's school bag, read, "I am very sorry I did this, but the school staff said so much that I had to do it. If any of my body (organs) works or is in condition to work, please donate it to someone who really needs it. My parents did a lot; I am sorry I couldn't give them anything. I'm sorry, brother, I was rude. I'm sorry, mother, I broke your heart so many times, now I will break it for the last time."

title: AR Rahman opens up on converting to Sufism; his name was Dileep Kumar
content: AR Rahman, born Dileep Kumar Rajagopala, embraced Sufism after studying various religions. He found a spiritual path in Sufism, describing it as a process of self-reflection and shedding ego. Rahman emphasizes the commonality of faith and the importance of spiritual richness, believing it leads to material prosperity.

title: Pakistan boiler blast: 15 workers killed at glue factory; owner flees
content: A devastating boiler explosion at a glue factory in Faisalabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 15 lives and injured seven others on Friday. The blast severely damaged the industrial unit and sparked a fire, with authorities investigating the cause and arresting the factory manager. This incident highlights the persistent issue of industrial accidents in Pakistan due to inadequate safety standards.

title: Big loans, bigger worries: Al-Falah students in a fix; many say they‚Äôve prepared for the worst
content: Al-Falah University students face immense anxiety after a professor was identified as a Delhi terror attack bomber and the founder was arrested. Concerns mount over the university's future, course accreditation, job prospects, and the substantial loans parents have taken for their children's expensive medical education.

title: Delhi school suicide: How a 'warning' over dance practice pushed teen to the brink; details emerge
content: A 16-year-old student, Shourya Patil, tragically died after reportedly jumping from a metro station, following a dispute with teachers over a dance performance due to a sprained ankle. A suicide note found in his bag blamed the school staff for his actions, leading to an FIR against four teachers who have since been suspended and barred from school contact.

title: Bangladesh earthquake: At least 6 killed, several injured; visuals emerge
content: A powerful 5.5-magnitude earthquake rocked central Bangladesh, claiming at least six lives and injuring many in Dhaka as buildings swayed and structures collapsed. The tremors were widely felt across the country and in neighbouring Indian regions, including Kolkata. Authorities are assessing damage and monitoring aftershocks in the densely populated capital.

title: Coal mafia crackdown: ED raids 40+ sites in Jharkhand, Bengal; huge stash of cash, gold seized
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted extensive searches at over 40 locations in Jharkhand and West Bengal as part of a money laundering probe into coal mafia operations. The investigation targets alleged coal theft, pilferage, and illegal mining, with significant financial losses to the government suspected.

title: 'A player‚Äôs career is on the line': Rahane fires warning shot at Gambhir over No.3 chaos
content: Former India vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane expressed concern over India's inconsistent selection for the crucial No. 3 batting position. He highlighted that frequent changes, like promoting Washington Sundar over Sai Sudharsan, disrupt player development and require specific preparation. Rahane emphasized the need for clarity and a long-term approach to nurture players in this pivotal role.

title: RMLAU admit card 2025 released for UG, PG odd semester exams; download schedule here
content: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia Avadh University (RMLAU), Ayodhya, has released the admit cards for UG and PG odd semester examinations for the 2025-26 session. The examination schedule for third and fifth semester UG and third semester PG exams is available on the official website and college login portals. Students must download the admit card from www.rmlau.ac.in and carry it to the examination centre. Colleges are instructed to ensure smooth conduct of exams as per NEP 2020.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper: When will Railways launch new train? Vaishnaw shares imp update
content: Vande Bharat sleeper train launch: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train in December, with the prototype undergoing modifications for enhanced passenger comfort. Following extensive trials, adjustments are being made to the bogies and seats to meet high standards.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices declined in futures trade as strong US employment data diminished expectations of a December interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve. A stronger dollar also pressured bullion, leading to a fall in both domestic and global markets.

title: Earthquake shocks Dhaka Test: Play halted during Bangladesh vs Ireland match ‚Äì Watch
content: Play in the Mirpur Test was briefly halted by an earthquake, unsettling players and spectators alike. Before the tremors, Ireland showed resilience, reaching 113 with a vital partnership. This followed Bangladesh's dominant day two, where Mushfiqur Rahim and Litton Das scored centuries, setting a strong total of 476.

title: 'Going since Trump boycotting it': Congress targets PM Modi over G20 summit
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticized PM Modi's G20 attendance, suggesting it was 'safe' due to US President Donald Trump's boycott. Ramesh questioned future 'huglomacy' with Trump, especially with the next summit in the US and ongoing trade talks. He also highlighted US opposition to South Africa's G20 themes.

title: Probe Agency ED Conducts Raids Across Bengal In Multi-Crore Coal Smuggling Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday conducted simultaneous raids and search operations at several locations across West Bengal, including the state capital Kolkata, as part of a money laundering probe against the coal mafia.

title: Probe Agency ED Conducts Raids Across Bengal In Multi-Crore Coal Smuggling Scam
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday conducted simultaneous raids and search operations at several locations across West Bengal, including the state capital Kolkata, as part of a money laundering probe against the coal mafia.

title: Explained: Negative G Manoeuvre That Tejas Pilot Performed Before Crash
content: An LCA Tejas fighter jet that crashed during an air show in Dubai was executing a negative G turn before it slammed the ground, aviation experts who saw visuals of the manoeuvre have said based on their initial assessment.

title: Gujarat Poll Officer Dies By Suicide, Family Says He Blamed SIR Workload
content: A school teacher deployed to work as a Booth Level Officer (BLO) allegedly died by suicide in Gujarat's Gir Somnath district on Friday.

title: Bricks, Sticks Fly As Groups Clash During Kartik Puja In West Bengal
content: Tensions flared in West Bengal's Krishnanagar during the immersion of idols after Kartik Puja, with visuals showing vandalism at a government bus passenger shelter.

title: 2 Crashes In 24 Years: 5 Facts About Tejas, Which Went Down At Dubai Air Show
content: An Indigenous fighter jet, Tejas, crashed on Friday afternoon during a flying demonstration at the Dubai Air Show. The pilot died in the crash, the Indian Air Force (IAF) confirmed.

title: "Wipe My A**": Ex-CIA Man On Pak Apology Demand Over 'India Will Win' Remark
content: A controversy has erupted after former CIA officer John Kiriakou revealed that former Pak PM Imran Khan's party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, tried to coerce him into apologising for comments he made on the conflict between Delhi and Islamabad.

title: 19-Year-Old Woman Raped, Murdered In UP, Accused Arrested: Cops
content: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Etah district has been arrested for allegedly raping and murdering a 19-year-old woman, officials said on Friday. The body of the young woman in a semi-naked condition in a drain near her village two days ago, they said.

title: Delhi Government Asks Schools To Postpone Sports Events Amid Poor Air Quality
content: The Delhi government has directed all schools, colleges, universities and sports bodies in the capital to postpone physical sports competitions scheduled for November and December due to the deteriorating air quality.

title: Expulsions, No Groceries: Kashmiri Students' Troubles Mount After Delhi Blast
content: Students from Jammu and Kashmir say they are facing discrimination as investigations in the November 10 Red Fort blast and white collar terror module revealed the involvement of doctors and other individuals from the Union Territory.

title: On Camera, Last Moments Of Tejas That Crashed In Dubai
content: A Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas crashed while performing a manoeuvre at the Dubai air show today. People at the event who captured the final moments of the homegrown fighter jet on video posted on social media that they didnt see any ejection.

title: Government Notifies 4 Labour Codes, 29 Existing Laws Rationalised
content: In a historic decision, the government on Friday announced the implementation of the four Labour Codes, which rationalised 29 existing labour laws, with immediate effect.

title: "10 More Days, Would've Changed His School": Father On Delhi Boy's Suicide
content: The Class 10 student of a prestigious Delhi school who died by suicide wanted to enrol in an acting school in Mumbai after graduation and enter Bollywood.

title: What Teen Thrashed Over Language Row Told His Father Before Suicide
content: A day after a student from Thane died by suicide following an argument over not speaking Marathi in a local train, his father said that his son kept repeating that he was beaten up ruthlessly.

title: Delhi To Tokyo: ISS Shares Stunning Night Images Of World's Brightest Cities
content: The International Space Station (ISS) has shared a breathtaking view of Earth at night. This series of stunning visuals shows some of the most luminous urban centres, visible even from space.

title: Indian-Origin Students Help UAE Win Gold At 'Olympics Of Robotics'
content: A United Arab Emirates team, represented by Indian-origin students, has won the gold medal at the 2025 FIRST Global Challenge. It's also called the "Olympics of Robotics".

title: "May It Prosper": Uday Kotak Shares Emotional Note On 40 Years Of Kotak Mahindra Bank
content: Kotak Mahindra Bank founder Uday Kotak marked a major milestone on Friday, reflecting on the institution's four-decade journey from a small office in Mumbai to one of India's leading private-sector banks.

title: Trinamool To Ramp Up Fight Against Voter Revision With Focus On Matuas
content: Amid the political tussle in West Bengal over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise between the TMC and the BJP,  Trinamool National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee will virtually address over 10,000 party leaders on Monday.

title: UN Remains "Indispensable" Despite Gaza, Ukraine "Failures": Shashi Tharoor
content: Shashi Tharoor, who earlier served as the UN undersecretary-general, noted that stepping back from the UN would amount to giving up the common principles that unite the global community.

title: Trump's Plan Would Expand West Coast, Arctic Offshore Drilling
content: The Interior Department is proposing as many as 34 offshore lease sales, including 21 off the coast of Alaska, six along the Pacific Coast and seven in the Gulf of Mexico, renamed the Gulf of America by President Donald Trump.

title: 34th youth festival of UAS Dharwad from November 21
content: University of Agricultural Sciences (UAS), Dharwad has organised the 34th Intercollegiate Youth festival at Farmers‚Äô Knowledge Centre on its campus from November 21 to 24

title: Extreme weather events claim 4,064 lives across India in nine months, CSE report
content: India faced extreme weather on 99% of days in the first nine months of 2025, killing 4,064 people and damaging 9.47 million hectares of crops¬†¬†

title: Family from Bagalkot loses five-year-old baby in leopard attack, Karnataka Forest Department begins operation to capture wild animal
content: Sanvi was playing in front of the shed where her family stays when the leopard attacked and carried her away

title: Government claim that lawmakers cannot discuss ECI is violation of powers of Parliament: Derek O'Brien
content: The budget of the ECI... is subject to Parliamentary approval and is presented by the Union government through the Ministry of Law and Justice. This means that Parliament does have the power to scrutinise and discuss the ECI by virtue of holding the power of the purse, says TMC leader Derek O'Brien

title: Ballari jeans units with own ETP get approval to re-open: MLA Nara Bharath Reddy
content: The units had been shut down by the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) for mishandling of effluent

title: Seven BLOs of Kolkata issued show-cause notices by ECI
content: The complaint concerns improper and incomplete digitisation of collected enumeration forms, says the official

title: World collectively needs to hike climate finance: India at COP30
content: Bhupender Yadav highlighted India‚Äôs efforts and experiences in accessing adaptation finance, the barriers faced by developing countries and the global steps needed to raise adaptation ambition

title: Himachal man who lost his memory reunited with family after 45 years
content: Rikhi was working at a hotel in Haryana's Yamunanagar when he met with a major road accident during a trip to Ambala. He sustained a head injury and went missing back in 1980

content: The 20-minute long EP has three tracks featuring instruments such as didjeridoo, djembe, conga, handpan, darbuka, bongo, and oud

title: RSS involvement will not resolve Manipur crisis: Congress president Meghachandra
content: Reacting to the three-day tour of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, he said any visit that "prioritises strengthening organisational growth" over the suffering of the people sends a wrong message

content: In a social media post, Mr. Stalin said the Supreme Court‚Äôs opinion in its answer to the Presidential Reference ‚Äúwill have no impact on the April 8, 2025 judgment in the case of State of Tamil Nadu v. Governor of Tamil Nadu.‚Äù

content: Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju showed the court a video of a crowd carrying sticks. He said the rioters went to an area where the sticks were collected, tested the sticks and used them in Delhi.

content: The move is expected to shield the airline from foreign exchange fluctuations, as lease payments are typically dollar-denominated

title: Kerala vehicle fitness test fees surge up to tenfold amid new regulations by Centre
content: After Ministry of Road Transport and Highways hiked fees by amending Central Motor Vehicle Rules (Fifth Amendment) recently, Kerala Motor Vehicles dept has enforced revised rates for fitness tests

title: Al-Falah Group chairman‚Äôs family property in Mhow gets notice for unauthorised construction
content: As per the notice, the department had previously issued multiple communications dating back to 1996 and 1997 under relevant sections of the Cantonments Act, 1924, directing the removal of the unauthorised construction,‚Äù the Cantonment Engineer said

title: Jawaharlal Nehru‚Äôs writings are not just history, they are record of India's evolving conscience, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha remarks came over the completion of the digitisation of 'Selected Works of Jawaharlal Nehru'

title: U.S. sanctions Indian entities, individuals involved in Iranian petroleum and petroleum products sales
content: Those sanctioned include Zair Husain Iqbal Husain Sayed, Zulfikar Hussain Rizvi Sayed, Maharashtra-based RN Ship Management Private Limited and Pune-based TR6 Petro India LLP

title: Allahabad High Court refuses to quash FIR against accused in Bareilly violence case
content: As per the prosecution‚Äôs case, Maulana Tauqeer Raza had allegedly given a call to members of a particular community to assemble at the Islamiya Inter College in Bareilly on September 26

title: West Bengal government convenes meeting with District Magistrates over 2026 Assembly polls on Saturday
content: "It will focus on the electoral infrastructure and Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs). Those in remote districts will join via the virtual mode," say sources

title: Strong tremors felt in Kolkata, other parts of West Bengal
content: According to official data from the National Center for Seismology, the earthquake was of 5.7 magnitude and occurred in Bangladesh, at a depth of 10 km

title: Centre announces top-level bureaucratic reshuffle; Neeraj Mittal appointed Petroleum and Natural Gas secretary
content: Amit Agrawal, secretary, Department of Pharmaceuticals, has been appointed as Telecommunications secretary, in place of Mr. Mittal

title: Deputy Commissioner Fouzia Taranum directs permanent relocation of dogs from school and hospital premises in Kalaburagi district
content: She instructed that stray cattle obstructing traffic on State and National Highways and other major roads must be permanently shifted to designated cattle shelters or gaushalas

title: Aerial adventure: Paramotoring activities begin in Visakhapatnam
content: Tandem paramotoring at Rushikonda and Sagarnagar is drawing visitors eager to see the coastline from the air

title: Kerala local body polls: Perform or perish is the mantra for political fronts in central Kerala
content: Barring Ernakulam district, the CPI (M)-led LDF has been sitting pretty in all the other three districts of the region. Much is at stake for the UDF and the Congress in these districts, as the dispensation has been forced to sit in the Opposition in most of the local bodies during the last term. The NDA was nowhere in the political scene in the region during the last election

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF poised for a comeback in Thrissur, says Rajan J. Pallan
content: Congress leader and Leader of Opposition in the Thrissur Corporation says a strong and unmistakable wave is rising in favour of the Congress and voters are ready to correct what he calls the slip between the lip and the cup in the last election

title: Kerala local body polls: Elections in Pala heat up as CPI(M) renegade comes up with family alliance
content: Binu Pulikkakkandam has assembled a three-member alliance comprising only his close family. Under the plan, he will contest from Ward 14, while his daughter Diya will enter the race from Ward 15, and his brother Biju Pulikkakandam will contest from Ward 13

title: Faridabad Police forms SIT to probe Al Falah University's activities
content: The SIT, which consists of two assistant commissioners of police, an inspector, and two sub-inspectors, is preparing a comprehensive report on the university's activities

title: Is air pollution a South Asian crisis? | Explained
content: What was the 2024 India-Pakistan Smog? How has air pollution become rampant across the South Asian region? What does the Greenpeace 2023 World Air Quality Report state? How do deteriorating AQI levels affect India economically? What should be the way ahead?

title: Integrated Child Development Services programme: A 50-year lifeline
content: Fifty years after it was launched as a pilot project in T. Narasipur in Mysuru district, the ICDS programme has expanded in reach and scope across Karnataka. But the crucial scheme for early childhood development faces several challenges, especially of fund crunch, says Shilpa Elizabeth

title: The caste and class factors in the NDA‚Äôs victory in Bihar
content: The majority of upper caste voters, OBCS (except Yadavs), and Dalits chose the NDA, as did a majority of the upper and middle class voters

title: Projecting Round 1 of next year's draft
content: the 2026 draft is based on the standings through Week 11 . four teams currently have multiple first-round picks . the Rams ( from the Falcons ), the Browns (from the Jaguars ) and the Cowboys ( . from the Packers .
